info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 3:42PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Fairfield, central Westchester and Rockland Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 342 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ossining, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stamford, New City, Ossining, New Canaan, Haverstraw, Tarrytown, Mount Kisco, Nyack, Tappan, Greenwich, Hawthorne, Orangeburg, Upper Nyack, Bedford and Yorktown Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southern Connecticut...northeastern New Jersey...and southeastern New York.
